subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: Gardner-Webb limited Kentucky to 35.5 percent field-goal shooting last night and built a 38-27 halftime lead in trouncing the Wildcats on their home court, 84-68, in a Coaches vs. Cancer game. Gardner-Webb advanced to the semifinals Nov. 15 at Madison Square Garden Garden. Grayson Flittner led Gardner-Webb with 22 points and Thomas Sanders had 21. Ramel Bradley led Kentucky with 24.
